about.title: Front-End
about.description: I’m a goal oriented front-end developer from Vancouver, B.C. My passion is JavaScript, and I’m constantly learning new front-end technologies that enable me to build web applications with efficiency and organization. The challenge of learning something new excites me.

about.title: Back-End
about.description: I’m aquainted with back-end technologies, such as PHP, Laravel, MySQL. I have created custom CMS’s and CRUD applications. I am currently undertaking the learning of employing JavaScript for backend development using Node.js.

about.title: Design
about.description: I have an appreciation for clean design that is communicative and simple to use. I understand that user experience is at the forefront of any application, and I’m constantly considering the user’s perspective during development.

about.title: Interests
about.description: I’m very dedicated to my work, but when I’m not sitting in front of a computer doing my thing, you’ll most likely find me enjoying the outdoors, listening to music, playing some sort of game, or trying something completely new.

works.name: Board Buddies
works.description: Social application for finding people to play board games with
details: Board Buddies is a web application that connects individuals who are interested in playing board games, by enabling them to create and join board game events in their area. Our nine team members were all invested in making this idea a reality, as we felt that this was a need that our community lacked. As a member of the front-end development team, I was tasked with creating an interface that was easy to use, performant and reusable while maintaining constant communication with the other members of the team.
role: Provide feedback on designs from a user experience perspective.
Develop the front end of web application based on mockups created by UX designers.
Refactor code to be adhearing to best practices.
Communicate with back end developer to ensure functionality is done in an efficient manner
Use Agile Scrum Methodologies when developing
Contribute to github and communicate via slack
functionality: Filter events based on location, date and keywords.
Display differences in user states visually

works.name: Exotic Typography
details: A mock typography studio based in China. This project was an assignment which, from introduction to deployment, I had 48 hours to complete. I was expected to research typography studios, create a design based on the client brief while considering other competitors in the area. Features a custom coded CMS with PHP. Fully responsive.
role: Research the target market and competitors
Create wireframes and mockups to satisfy the company goals
Develop a beautifully responsive website that follows the mockups
Develop backend which client can use to update content

works.name: Alexandra Minues
works.description: A portfolio website for a Game Artist
details: A portfolio website created for an Environmemnt Artist to showcase her works and demo reel.
role: Meet with client and discuss goals of website and design direction
Design mockup that follows design direction of the client.
Develop a pixel perfect custom theme in wordpress.
Set up hosting with AWS.
functionality: A fully customizable site using Wordpress

works.name: VanArts Radio
works.description: A website created for the promotion of the VanArts radio station
details:
A website created for the Broadcasting & Online Media program at VanArts to promote their radio station that is hosted at Mixlr. This website began as a school project, where I was tasked with creating a custom CMS. 
 The program was previously using a Wordpress site and was interested in getting this site imported to Wordpress, so I was tasked with learning how to import a custom theme into Wordpress.
role: Research competitor radio stations in the local area
Design and develop website that adheres to client's goals
Convert into a wordpress theme

works.name: Boxspring Studio
works.description: A mock design studio in New York City who specializes in graphic design for the restaurant and bar industry.
details: A website designed and developed for a graphic design studio in New York City. Their goal was to expand reach to outside of New York City into surrounding areas.
role: Meet with client, understand business goals and direction
Design wireframes and mockups based on business goals
Develop a fully responsive website
Create custom icons for services.

works.name: Ediphotos
details: Ediphotos was a mock photography studio in Toronto, who was looking to find new clients across the globe. This project had to be production ready in 24 hours. I had to research, design and develop a fully mobile responsive website with CMS integration to upload and remove photos.
role: Research competitors in the Toronto area
Design mockups
Develop based on my mockups
